item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，华纳兄弟发现公司考虑分拆公司以提高股价
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）已经讨论了将其数字流媒体和工作室业务从传统电视网络中分离出来的计划，这家美国媒体巨头正在权衡各种方案，以提振其下挫的股价。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery has discussed a plan to split its digital streaming and studio businesses from its legacy television networks as the U.S. media giant weighs options for boosting its sagging share price, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 行业机构 ACEA 称欧盟 6 月新车销量增长 4.3
item.description: 欧洲汽车行业机构周四发布的数据显示，受主要市场意大利、德国和西班牙增长的推动，6月份欧盟新车销量增长4.3%，创2019年7月以来新高，而电池电动汽车的注册量则略有下降。【原文：New car sales in the European Union rose 4.3% in June to their highest since July 2019, driven by an uptick in major markets Italy, Germany, and Spain, while registrations of battery electric cars fell marginally, data from Europe's auto industry body showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 垂直农业初创企业 Plenty 将通过与阿联酋 Mawarid 公司成立价值 6.8 亿美元的合资公司进行扩张
item.description: 美国垂直农业初创公司 Plenty 正与阿尔法-达比控股公司（Alpha Dhabi Holding）的子公司 Mawarid 成立合资企业，双方将在中东开发室内农场网络，交易金额达 6.8 亿美元。【原文：U.S. vertical farming startup Plenty is forming a joint venture with Mawarid, a subsidiary of Alpha Dhabi Holding , in a $680 million deal to develop a network of indoor farms in the Middle East, the companies told Reuters.】

item.title: 泰威啤酒计划通过换股交易出售物业资产
item.description: 东南亚最大的啤酒生产商泰国饮料公司计划剥离其房地产资产，通过与其所有者、富豪 Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi 持有的其他公司进行股份交换，成为一家纯粹的饮料和食品公司。【原文：Thai Beverage , Southeast Asia's biggest brewer, plans to divest its real estate assets and become a pure-play drinks and food firm in a share swap with other companies held by its owner, tycoon Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi.】

item.title: 渣打银行增聘 14 名新员工，壮大私人银行团队
item.description: 渣打银行周四发表声明称，该行已为新加坡、香港和阿拉伯联合酋长国的私人银行团队招聘了十多名新银行家，以发展富裕阶层业务。【原文：Standard Chartered has hired more than a dozen new bankers to its private banking teams in Singapore, Hong Kong and the United Arab Emirates in a bid to grow the affluent business, a bank statement said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储降息预期升温，黄金大放异彩
item.description: 周四金价走高，距离上一交易日创下的历史新高不远，原因是对美国9月份降息的预期升温提振了需求。【原文：Gold prices edged higher on Thursday, trading not too far away from a record high scaled in the previous session, as rising anticipation of a U.S. interest rate cut in September boosted demand.】

item.title: 比亚迪将向越南市场再推出三款车型
item.description: 比亚迪越南公司首席运营官 Vo Minh Luc 周四表示，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪将于今年 10 月向越南市场推出另外三款车型，并计划在 2026 年将经销商数量扩大到 100 家。【原文：Chinese electric carmaker BYD will introduce three more models to the Vietnamese market this October and plans to expand its dealerships to 100 in 2026, Chief Operations Officer of BYD Vietnam Vo Minh Luc said on Thursday.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势加剧，亚洲股市下滑，日元攀升
item.description: 由于投资者对中美贸易紧张局势升级的前景感到担忧，周四亚洲股市下跌，芯片类股领跌，而日元则在上周东京疑似采取干预措施后飙升至六周高点。【原文：Asian equities fell on Thursday, led by chip stocks as investors fret over the prospect of escalating trade tensions between the U.S. and China, while the yen surged to a six-week high in the wake of suspected interventions by Tokyo last week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 6 月就业岗位增加 5.02 万个，失业率仍在上升
item.description: 澳大利亚 6 月份的就业率大幅超出预期，但失业率仍在上升，因为有更多的人去找工作。【原文：Australian employment jumped well beyond expectations in June, yet the jobless rate still ticked higher as more people went looking for work, a mixed report that leaves open the question of whether interest rates need to rise further.】

item.title: 澳大利亚多米诺比萨因门店增长乏力跌至逾 9 年低点
item.description: 澳大利亚多米诺比萨企业的股价周四创下九年多来的新低，因为该公司决定关闭日本和法国的低销量门店后，分析师下调了其盈利前景。【原文：Shares in Australia's Domino's Pizza Enterprises hit a more than nine-year low on Thursday, as analysts cut their earnings outlook after the company decided to close low-volume stores in Japan and France.】

item.title: 三星电子、SK 海力士股价下滑，追随全球芯片股跌势
item.description: 韩国主要芯片制造商三星电子和 SK 海力士周四分别下跌 1.9% 和 3.9%，追随全球芯片股的跌势。【原文：South Korea's major chipmakers Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix fell 1.9% and 3.9%, respectively, on Thursday, following losses in global chip stocks.】

item.title: 美国原油库存降幅大于预期，油价上涨
item.description: 受美国原油库存周降幅大于预期的影响，油价周四走高。【原文：Oil prices ticked higher on Thursday, buoyed by a bigger-than-expected weekly decline in U.S. crude stocks.】

item.title: 干预幽灵令投资者恐慌，日元飙升
item.description: 日本的日元周四创下六周新高，刺激了对官方推动的猜测，而美元则因市场为几个月后的美国降息做准备而普遍下跌。【原文：Japan's yen scaled a six-week high on Thursday, spurring speculation of an official push, while the dollar nursed broad losses as markets prepared for U.S. rate cuts in a few months.】

item.title: 保险经纪公司 TWFG 在美国的首次公开募股定价高于区间，将筹资约 1.87 亿美元
item.description: 由美国再保险公司复兴再保险（RenaissanceRe）支持的保险经纪公司 TWFG 周三表示，其首次公开募股（IPO）的定价高于预期范围，寻求筹集最多 1.87 亿美元的资金。【原文：Insurance broker TWFG , backed by U.S. reinsurer RenaissanceRe , said on Wednesday it priced its initial public offering (IPO) above its indicated range, seeking to raise up to $187 million.】

item.title: 台积电将公布强劲利润；特朗普言论令股价承压
item.description: 台湾中芯国际集成电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , the dominant producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence (AI) applications, is expected to report a 30% jump in second-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to soaring demand.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会起诉数字世界公司前首席执行官，指控其证券欺诈
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周三起诉数字世界收购公司（Digital World Acquisition Corp）前首席执行官帕特里克-奥兰多（Patrick Orlando）证券欺诈，该公司曾帮助美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普的社交媒体公司上市。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday sued Patrick Orlando, ex-chief of Digital World Acquisition Corp that helped former U.S. President Donald Trump's social media company go public, for securities fraud.】

item.title: 超过 40% 的日本公司没有利用人工智能的计划
item.description: 路透社周四的一项调查显示，近四分之一的日本公司已在其业务中采用人工智能（AI），而超过 40% 的日本公司还没有利用这一尖端技术的计划。【原文：Nearly a quarter of Japanese companies have adopted artificial intelligence (AI) in their businesses, while more than 40% have no plan to make use of the cutting-edge technology, a Reuters survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: Meta 决定暂停其在巴西的生成式人工智能工具
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周三表示，由于巴西政府反对其有关个人数据和人工智能的新隐私政策，该公司决定暂停在巴西使用生成式人工智能工具。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Wednesday it decided to suspend use of generative artificial intelligence tools in Brazil in response to the government's objections to its new privacy policy regarding personal data and AI.】

item.title: 亚洲：科技股下跌，日元飙升，波动性卷土重来
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 发现金融公司季度利润因利息收入增加而大幅增长
item.description: 发现金融服务公司（Discover Financial Services）周三公布的第二季度利润增长了 70%，原因是高利率环境帮助这家美国信贷发行商获得了更多的利息收入。【原文：Discover Financial Services on Wednesday reported a 70% rise in second-quarter profit, as a high-rate environment helped the U.S. credit issuer earn more in interest income.】

item.title: 抵押贷款市场放缓，Equifax 第三季度营收低于预期
item.description: 周三，消费者信用评级公司 Equifax 预计第三季度营收将低于华尔街预期，原因是利率持续走高导致抵押贷款市场复苏受阻。【原文：Consumer credit ratings firm Equifax forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday as higher-for-longer interest rates continue to derail recovery in mortgage markets.】

item.title: 橄榄园母公司达顿将斥资 6.05 亿美元收购 Chuy's
item.description: 达顿餐饮公司（Darden Restaurants）和橄榄园连锁店（Olive Garden）的所有者周三表示，已同意以全服务餐厅运营商 Chuy's Holdings 的全现金交易方式收购该公司，企业价值为 6.05 亿美元。【原文：Darden Restaurants , owner of the Olive Garden chain, has agreed to buy full-service restaurant operator Chuy's Holdings in an all-cash deal which has an enterprise value of $605 million, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 对冲基金在科技大盘股抛售中规避风险，高盛称
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）周三在一份报告中说，在整个市场大型科技相关股票回落的情况下，全球对冲基金已经连续五天减少了对美国股市的投资。【原文：Global hedge funds have been reducing their exposure to U.S. stocks for five days in a row amid a market-wide pullback in megacap tech-related stocks, Goldman Sachs said in a note on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司第三季度利润低于预期，原因是机组人员协议带来的冲击
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空集团（Alaska Air Group）周三预计第三季度利润低于预期，原因是其新的空乘人员合同协议带来了财务冲击，而其第二季度盈利超出了市场预期。【原文：Alaska Air Group forecast third-quarter profit below estimates on Wednesday, citing a financial hit from its new flight attendant contract deal, while it topped market expectations for second-quarter earnings.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Beyond Meat 与债券持有人商讨资产负债表重组事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，Beyond Meat 已与一群债券持有人接触，开始讨论资产负债表重组事宜。【原文：Beyond Meat has engaged with a group of bondholders to initiate discussions about a balance-sheet restructuring, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 管道运营商金德摩根第二季度业绩不及预期
item.description: 美国输油管道和码头运营商金德摩根公司（Kinder Morgan）周三公布的第二季度利润和收入不及华尔街预期，受成本上升和二氧化碳业务疲软的影响。【原文：U.S. pipeline and terminal operator Kinder Morgan on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit and revenue, weighed down by higher costs and weakness in its CO2 segment.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司第三季度利润前景令人失望，全行业面临折扣压力
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines Holdings）周三预计，由于国内市场座位数过剩，削弱了航空公司的定价能力，该公司本季度的利润将低于预期。【原文：United Airlines Holdings on Wednesday forecast lower-than-expected profit in the current quarter as the industry grapples with excess seat capacity in the domestic market, which has undermined airlines' pricing power.】

item.title: 真人秀放缓推动好莱坞制作下滑
item.description: 周三公布的统计数据显示，随着好莱坞努力从去年的双重罢工中恢复过来，洛杉矶的真人秀节目制作量大幅下降。【原文：Los Angeles experienced a hefty decline in reality TV production as Hollywood worked to recover from dual labor strikes last year, according to statistics released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 前高盛、Blackstone 分析师因内幕交易被判处 28 个月监禁
item.description: 周三，一名前高盛和黑石分析师因内幕交易罪被判处 28 个月监禁，他承认自己的行为 "愚蠢至极"。【原文：A former Goldman Sachs and Blackstone analyst was sentenced to 28 months in prison on Wednesday for insider trading, after admitting that his conduct was "catastrophically stupid."】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，最近几周更多美国联储地区经济活动出现回落
item.description: 5 月底至 7 月初，美国经济活动略有小幅扩张，企业报告称，有迹象表明就业市场继续疲软，这凸显了美联储最近转向更加敏锐地评估放缓的劳动力需求，以确保在降息之前不会等待太久。【原文：U.S. economic activity expanded at a slight to modest pace from late May through early July and firms reported some signs that the jobs market continues to soften, underscoring the Federal Reserve's recent pivot to more keenly assessing slowing demand for labor to ensure it doesn't wait too long before cutting interest rates.】
